result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.   This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CF44 and 14CF234.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and Attorney Prior by telephone.  Set for a plea 10/12/15 at 1:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 09-02-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-21-2015 03:00 pm.
same appearances.  Defendant stood mute to the charges.  NGP entered.  PTC set for 9/2/15 at STC set for 9/21/15 at 3 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  WOPH form filed with the court.  Court reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendnat knowingly and intelligently waived her right to a preliminary hearing.  Information filed with court.
Waiver of Prelim at 08-10-2015 02:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Schedule waiver of preliminary hearing.
Status conference at 06-22-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Attorney Prior stated his is still waiting form discovery on 14CF234.  He received discovery this AM on 15CF44 & 46.  ADA Inlow just became aware of the issue today.  She e-mailed SO to have the discovery done by Friday.  Court told ADA Inlow to remind SO of their obligation to disclose.  STC set for 6/22/15 at 3 pm.  Attorney Prior can appear by telephone.
Status conference at 05-26-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Attorney Prior advised the court that he has received the police reports.  He has not received all discovery from the DA's office yet.  STC set for 5/26/15 at 3 pm
a male caller called said Sandra S and Gregory S are unable to come to court; explained they need to call their atty's; he stated he did

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Report for Booking.

Status conference at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person.  Attorney Prior appeared by telephone.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defense waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court questioned defendant of her understanding of waiver of time limits.  Defendant understood.  Court finds that defendant waived her time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bond set.  PTC & STC set.

This case includes 15CF46 and 15CF44:    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Report for booking.
